snippet: There are no women on the European Central Bank’s executive board, a point that is delaying a hearing to consider the candidacy of Yves Mersch, governor of the Luxembourg central bank.
abstract: Sharon Bowles, chairwoman of the European Parliament's economic and monetary affairs committee, announces that a hearing to fill a seat on the executive board of the European Central Bank has been postponed after officials ignored demands to develop a plan to promote more women as candidates.
lead_paragraph: There are no women on the European Central Bank’s executive board, a point that is delaying a hearing to consider the candidacy of Yves Mersch, governor of the Luxembourg central bank.

headline.seo: European Central Bank Candidacy Delayed Over Lack of Women
headline.main: European Central Bank Candidacy Delayed Over Lack of Women
headline.print_headline: European Central Bank Hearing Is Put Off Over Lack of Female Nominee
